Blocks.Content:
Indiaâ€™s first all in one 
corporate treasury & multi family office 
platform

services.heading: Wealth and Treasury Management
services.subheading: Assisting in investment policy writing; investment management across asset classes & products; portfolio monitoring, reporting, reviews, and risk management

services.heading: Fund Raise and Credit Solutions
services.subheading: Debt Syndication, promoter funding, structured/acquisition finance, growth capital, SME finance, loan against securities/property and startup funding

services.heading: Bond Desk & Fixed Income Solutions
services.subheading: Primary and secondary bonds, corporate bonds, MLDs, corporate FDs, tax free bonds, PSU bonds & state development loans, approved investment for trust, CP

services.heading: Alternate Investments Solutions
services.subheading: Access to PMS and AIF products shortlisted basis detailed due dilligence across portfolio and performance metrics, in a cost effective manner

services.heading: Insights and Reports
services.subheading: Market commentaries, daily newsletter and updates,curated client reports, event based reports, periodic portfolio reports

Blocks.heading: How are we different
Blocks.subheading: Consultative Guidance to streamline  your business

items.cardDescription: We provide investment solutions and guidance that is fully supported by objective due diligence and investment process.
We are able to anticipate and serve the most complex financial needs of our clients by offering investment solutions and guidance.
Our team is comprised of highly credentialed and experienced professionals to help you build your investment portfolio.

productPanel.tabPanelCardHeading: Expert guidance to manage & operate your mutual funds
productPanel.productFeatures:
Invest for your future with direct plans
Get upto 1% higher returns with direct plans
Flexiblity to invest
Schemes for Every Financial Goals

productPanel.tabPanelCardHeading: Curated Fixed Deposits & Over Draft Facility for Corporates & Family Offices
productPanel.productFeatures:
Corporate Term Deposits
Curated Fixed Deposits
Redeemable Deposit, No Volatility or Mark-to-Market Risk
AAA Rated Issuers
Higher Returns compared to Bank FDs

productPanel.tabPanelCardHeading: Discover our customised bond solutions, pricing competitiveness and seamless execution capability
productPanel.productFeatures:
Fixed Income: Provides investor with a steady stream of income.
Multiple Offerings across Corporate Bonds, Money Market Instruments, Tax Free Bonds, Global Bonds etc. 
Portfolio Diversification: Enable efficient portfolio diversification and thus assist in portfolio risk-mitigation.
Transparent & Competitive Pricing

productPanel.tabPanelCardHeading: Dedicated experts to manage your corpus with chosen portfolios designed to compound long term wealth
productPanel.productFeatures:
Dedicated experts to design strategies suited to every investment style
Strategic allocation and tactical calls
Regular Portfolio monitoring & Rebalancing recommendations
Chosen alternate strategies with low to NIL fixed fee structures, profit sharing models

productCard.cardDescription: We provide investment solutions and guidance that is fully supported by objective due diligence and investment process.
The platform's intuitive interface makes it simple for users to track the performance of their investments in real-time.
We provide personalized advice and recommendations tailored to your specific investment goals and risk tolerance.
We provide users with advanced risk management tools to help them identify and mitigate potential risks in their investment portfolio.

whyCorpcareCard.cardDescription: Our app is built for the ease of clients who wants to manage all his investments like FD, Bonds, AIFs, PMS in single platform.
Our team is comprised by a dedicated investment research team which analyses the performance & selects suitable investments for you.
We employ the latest security protocols & partner with reputable platforms to keep your money safe and ensure transparency.
Our team is comprised of highly credentialed and experienced professionals to help you build your investment portfolio.

Clients.comment: As sharp as they are sensitive, the core team of CorpCare are seasoned industry professionals who organised and expanded my portfolio with exhaustive market research and brilliant, expert insight.  Highly recommended!

How to convert your debts into assets in 4 easy steps?
attributes.content:
## 5 Ways Debt Can Make You Money
The principal method of using debt to invest positively is the use of leverage to exponentially multiply your returns. What is leverage exactly? Leverage is using borrowed money to increase your return on investment. Leverage can allow you to achieve returns that you thought were impossible but at a greater risk of losing your capital.

Investing on margin allows you to buy a higher dollar amount of stock than you actually have money for. For example, if you had $50,000 in your traditional brokerage account, you could leverage your investment and open a margin account.

Forex trading allows investors to control large blocks of currencies with a small amount of capital. trading allows investors to control large blocks of currencies with a small amount 
Debt can be used as leverage to multiply the returns of an investment but also means that losses could be higher.
Although typically considered a negative measure, the use of debt can be a positive one if it is used and managed correctly.
Many hedge funds use leverage but are often only available to high-net-worth individuals.
Short selling is borrowing stocks with the intention of expecting a drop in the security borrowed.
Up-to-date with the latest Web trends, techniques and technologies
A margin account allows you to put up a max of 50% of the purchase price of a stock. You would have $50,000 in cash and an additional $50,000 would be loaned to you from your broker. Your $50,000 investment gives you $100,000 worth of buying power. You could use this money and buy $100,000 worth of stock.

If the stock price appreciates, then you can pay back the loan and pocket the profit. The negative is that if the equity in your account falls below a certain value, your brokerage firm can issue a margin call. If you can't meet your margin call because you don't have enough funds, your broker can liquidate your entire position in a stock leaving you with losses.

attributes.title: Daily Market Wrapup - 3 April 2023
attributes.content:
*CorpCare Daily Market Wrapup - 3 April 2023*

> Indian benchmark equity indices advanced on Friday led by gains in banking and IT shares amid easing of worries over the global banking turmoil

> Yield of the 10-year benchmark 7.26% 2032 paper ended higher at 7.32% on Friday compared to 7.29% on Wednesday

> India output of core sectors grew 6% on-year in February, compared to revised 8.9% gain in January as except crude oil all sectors witnessed growth

> Rupee ended higher against the US dollar on Friday following foreign fund inflows and positive trend in the domestic equity markets

> Wall Street stocks advanced on Friday after PCE price index slowed in February, raising expectations of softer monetary policy stance by the Fed

attributes.title: Daily Market Wrapup - 31 March 2023
attributes.content:
**CorpCare Daily Market Wrap-up - 31 March 2023**

> Indian equity indices ended higher on Wednesday on broad-based buying across sectors tracking global positive cues as investor worries over the global banking turmoil eased

> Yield of the 10-year benchmark 7.26% 2032 paper ended lower at 7.29% on Wednesday compared to 7.32% on Tuesday

> Commerce and Industry minister Piyush Goyal said that amid a series of economic challenges faced by many countries across the world, India is in a â€˜bright spot'

> SEBI tweaked the time limit for disclosure of net asset value (NAV) of mutual fund schemes investing overseas due to differences in time zones and market hours

> Rupee closed lower against the US dollar on Wednesday owing to strong dollar index and rise in crude oil prices

attributes.title: How to convert your debts into assets in 4 easy steps?
attributes.content:
## 5 Ways Debt Can Make You Money
The principal method of using debt to invest positively is the use of leverage to exponentially multiply your returns. What is leverage exactly? Leverage is using borrowed money to increase your return on investment. Leverage can allow you to achieve returns that you thought were impossible but at a greater risk of losing your capital.

Investing on margin allows you to buy a higher dollar amount of stock than you actually have money for. For example, if you had $50,000 in your traditional brokerage account, you could leverage your investment and open a margin account.

Forex trading allows investors to control large blocks of currencies with a small amount of capital. trading allows investors to control large blocks of currencies with a small amount 
Debt can be used as leverage to multiply the returns of an investment but also means that losses could be higher.
Although typically considered a negative measure, the use of debt can be a positive one if it is used and managed correctly.
Many hedge funds use leverage but are often only available to high-net-worth individuals.
Short selling is borrowing stocks with the intention of expecting a drop in the security borrowed.
Up-to-date with the latest Web trends, techniques and technologies
A margin account allows you to put up a max of 50% of the purchase price of a stock. You would have $50,000 in cash and an additional $50,000 would be loaned to you from your broker. Your $50,000 investment gives you $100,000 worth of buying power. You could use this money and buy $100,000 worth of stock.

If the stock price appreciates, then you can pay back the loan and pocket the profit. The negative is that if the equity in your account falls below a certain value, your brokerage firm can issue a margin call. If you can't meet your margin call because you don't have enough funds, your broker can liquidate your entire position in a stock leaving you with losses.

attributes.title: Daily Market Wrapup - 3 April 2023
attributes.content:
*CorpCare Daily Market Wrapup - 3 April 2023*

> Indian benchmark equity indices advanced on Friday led by gains in banking and IT shares amid easing of worries over the global banking turmoil

> Yield of the 10-year benchmark 7.26% 2032 paper ended higher at 7.32% on Friday compared to 7.29% on Wednesday

> India output of core sectors grew 6% on-year in February, compared to revised 8.9% gain in January as except crude oil all sectors witnessed growth

> Rupee ended higher against the US dollar on Friday following foreign fund inflows and positive trend in the domestic equity markets

> Wall Street stocks advanced on Friday after PCE price index slowed in February, raising expectations of softer monetary policy stance by the Fed

attributes.title: Daily Market Wrapup - 31 March 2023
attributes.content:
**CorpCare Daily Market Wrap-up - 31 March 2023**

> Indian equity indices ended higher on Wednesday on broad-based buying across sectors tracking global positive cues as investor worries over the global banking turmoil eased

> Yield of the 10-year benchmark 7.26% 2032 paper ended lower at 7.29% on Wednesday compared to 7.32% on Tuesday

> Commerce and Industry minister Piyush Goyal said that amid a series of economic challenges faced by many countries across the world, India is in a â€˜bright spot'

> SEBI tweaked the time limit for disclosure of net asset value (NAV) of mutual fund schemes investing overseas due to differences in time zones and market hours

> Rupee closed lower against the US dollar on Wednesday owing to strong dollar index and rise in crude oil prices

attributes.title: Market Bites - 31 March 2023
attributes.content:
*CorpCare Market Bites*

*Domestic benchmarks gain big tracking positive cues in global markets*

âš« Indian benchmarks rallied by 1+% as technology stocks continued to see renewed interest and led gains on Wall Street with investors shaking off concerns of a further banking crisis

âš« Global indices advanced, Asian stocks were headed for 2nd quarterly gain while USD declined as investors turned their focus to upcoming inflation data and outlook for interest rate hikes

âš« Oil prices were down as bullish sentiment about Chinese demand and potential Middle Eastern supply disruptions was tempered by uncertainty over US economic data

âš«  INR strengthened by 24 paise to 82.10 against USD amid FII inflows and drop in crude oil prices

âš« Oil prices were down as bullish sentiment about Chinese demand and potential Middle Eastern supply disruptions was tempered by uncertainty over US economic data

âš«  INR strengthened by 24 paise to 82.10 against USD amid FII inflows and drop in crude oil prices

attributes.title: Market Bites - 31 March 2023
attributes.content:
*CorpCare Market Bites*

*Domestic benchmarks gain big tracking positive cues in global markets*

âš« Indian benchmarks rallied by 1+% as technology stocks continued to see renewed interest and led gains on Wall Street with investors shaking off concerns of a further banking crisis

âš« Global indices advanced, Asian stocks were headed for 2nd quarterly gain while USD declined as investors turned their focus to upcoming inflation data and outlook for interest rate hikes

âš« Oil prices were down as bullish sentiment about Chinese demand and potential Middle Eastern supply disruptions was tempered by uncertainty over US economic data

âš«  INR strengthened by 24 paise to 82.10 against USD amid FII inflows and drop in crude oil prices
